words.definition: An administrator is a person who controls a business, company, or organization.
words.example: Everyone in the store did whatever the administrator asked them to do.

words.definition: If someone is affluent, they are wealthy.
words.example: People in the city are usually more affluent than people in the country.

words.definition: To audit means to inspect financial records from a person or business.
words.example: The government usually audits companies that report lower than usual incomes.

words.definition: To automate a company means to install machines or computers to do the work.
words.example: The factory was automated to increase production.

words.definition: To bribe someone means to give them money to do something for you.
words.example: The judge was bribed to let the criminal go free.

words.definition: If someone is corrupt, they use their power for their own benefit.
words.example: The corrupt policeman was eventually sent to jail.

words.definition: To dispose of something means to get rid of it.
words.example: He disposed of the old newspapers by recycling them.

words.definition: A headquarters is the main office of a company or organization.
words.example: The company’s headquarters is located in New York.

words.definition: An incentive is something that encourages a person to work harder.
words.example: The chance of a bonus was a great incentive for the employees.

words.definition: Infrastructure is the basic system of a country or city, such as roads and bridges.
words.example: The country’s infrastructure was damaged by the war.

words.definition: To legislate means to make laws.
words.example: The government decided to legislate against smoking in public places.

words.definition: If something is legitimate, it is permitted by law.
words.example: She had a legitimate reason for being late for work.

words.definition: To manipulate something means to control or influence it in a clever way.
words.example: The politician manipulated the news to make himself look good.

words.definition: Merchandise is goods that are bought and sold in business.
words.example: The store sells a wide variety of merchandise.

words.definition: Retail is the sale of goods to the public for their own use.
words.example: He works in retail, selling clothes to customers.

words.definition: Revenue is the money that a company or government receives.
words.example: The company’s revenue increased by 10% this year.

words.definition: Rubbish is garbage or waste that is thrown away.
words.example: Please put your rubbish in the trash can.

words.definition: A subsidy is money given by a government to help a business or industry.
words.example: The government provided a subsidy to the farmers.

words.definition: A transaction is a business deal or the act of buying and selling.
words.example: The transaction was completed once the money was paid.

words.definition: To violate a law or rule means to break it.
words.example: He violated the law when he drove through a red light.
